alertmanager_read_delay_after_change.description: When set, add a delay (time duration) to read the alertmanager config after a change.

alertmanager_read_retry_after_change.description: Max retries to read the alertmanager config after a change.

ca.description: Client ca (filepath or inline) for TLS client authentication.

cert.description: Client cert (filepath or inline) for TLS client authentication.

debug.description: Enable debug mode to trace requests executed.

format_promql_expr.description: Enable the formatting of PromQL expression.

headers.description: A map of header names and values to set on all outbound requests.

insecure.description: When using https, this disables TLS verification of the host.

key.description: Client key (filepath or inline) for TLS client authentication.

org_id.description: The default organization id to operate on within mimir. For resources that have an org_id attribute, the resource-level attribute has priority. May alternatively be set via the MIMIR_ORG_ID environment variable.

overwrite_alertmanager_config.description: Overwrite the current alertmanager config on create.

overwrite_rule_group_config.description: Overwrite the current rule group (alerting/recording) config on create.

password.description: When set, will use this password for BASIC auth to the API.

proxy_url.description: URL to the proxy to be used for all API requests

rule_group_read_delay_after_change.description: When set, add a delay (time duration) to read the rule group after a change.

rule_group_read_retry_after_change.description: Max retries to read the rule group after a change.

timeout.description: When set, will cause requests taking longer than this time (in seconds) to be aborted.

token.description: When set, will use this token for Bearer auth to the API.

username.description: When set, will use this username for BASIC auth to the API.

org_id.description: The Organization ID. If not set, the Org ID defined in the provider block will be used.

templates.description: A list of template names to use.

templates_files.description: A map of key values string, where the key is the template name and the value the content of the template.

resolve_timeout.description: The time after which an alert is declared resolved if it has not been updated.

smtp_auth_password.description: SMTP Auth using LOGIN and PLAIN.

smtp_auth_username.description: SMTP Auth using CRAM-MD5, LOGIN and PLAIN. If empty, Alertmanager doesn't authenticate to the SMTP server.

smtp_from.description: The default SMTP From header field.

smtp_hello.description: The default hostname to identify to the SMTP server.

smtp_smarthost.description: The default SMTP smarthost used for sending emails, including port number.

follow_redirects.description: Configure whether HTTP requests follow HTTP 3xx redirects.

block.description: Sets the `Authorization` header with the configured username and password.

endpoint_params.description: Parameters to append to the token URL.

token_url.description: The URL to fetch the token from.

group_by.description: The labels by which incoming alerts are grouped together.

group_interval.description: How long to wait before sending a notification about new alerts that are added to a group of alerts for which an initial notification has already been sent.

group_wait.description: How long to initially wait to send a notification for a group of alerts. Allows to wait for an inhibiting alert to arrive or collect more initial alerts for the same group.

receiver.description: Name of the receiver to send the notification.

repeat_interval.description: How long to wait before sending a notification again if it has already been sent successfully for an alert.

active_time_intervals.description: Times when the route should be active. These must match the name of a mute time interval defined in the time_interval block.

continue.description: Whether an alert should continue matching subsequent sibling nodes.

block.description: Although the `child_route` block is recursive, only 3 levels are supported by default. It could be defined by `MIMIR_ALERTMANAGER_CHILD_ROUTE_MAX_LEVEL` env var.
Although the `child_route` block is recursive, only 3 levels are supported by default. It could be defined by `MIMIR_ALERTMANAGER_CHILD_ROUTE_MAX_LEVEL` env var.
The root node of the routing tree.

name.description: Name interval of time that may be referenced in the routing tree to mute/activate particular routes for particular times of the day.

location.description: A string that matches a location in the IANA time zone database.

block.description: A list of numerical days in the month. Days begin at 1. Negative values are also accepted which begin at the end of the month.
A list of calendar months identified by number, where January = 1.
Ranges inclusive of the starting time and exclusive of the end time to make it easy to represent times that start/end on hour boundaries.
A list of numerical days of the week, where the week begins on Sunday (0) and ends on Saturday (6).
The actual definition for an interval of time.
A list of time intervals for muting/activating routes.

org_id.description: The Organization ID. If not set, the Org ID defined in the provider block will be used.

source_tenants.description: Allows aggregating data from multiple tenants while evaluating a rule group.

annotations.description: Annotations to add to each alert.

for.description: The duration for which the condition must be true before an alert fires.

keep_firing_for.description: How long an alert will continue firing after the condition that triggered it has cleared.

labels.description: Labels to add or overwrite for each alert.

evaluation_delay.description: **Deprecated** The duration by which to delay the execution of the recording rule.

org_id.description: The Organization ID. If not set, the Org ID defined in the provider block will be used.

query_offset.description: The duration by which to delay the execution of the recording rule.

source_tenants.description: Allows aggregating data from multiple tenants while evaluating a rule group.

labels.description: Labels to add or overwrite before storing the result.

record.description: The name of the time series to output to.

content.description: YAML content containing rule groups. Mutually exclusive with 'content_file'.

content_file.description: Path to YAML file containing rule groups. Mutually exclusive with 'content'.

content_hash.description: Hash of the rule configuration content

groups.description: Details of all managed rule groups

groups_count.description: Number of rule groups managed by this resource

ignore_groups.description: List of rule group names to ignore from the content. Useful when you want to manage most groups but exclude specific ones.

managed_groups.description: List of rule group names actually managed by this resource

namespace.description: The namespace for the rule groups

only_groups.description: Explicit list of rule group names to manage. If not specified, all groups in the content will be managed. Use this to manage only specific groups from a larger YAML file.

org_id.description: The Organization ID. If not set, the Org ID defined in the provider block will be used.

rule_names.description: List of all rule names actually managed by this resource

total_rules.description: Total number of rules across all managed groups

block.description:
Manages multiple Grafana Mimir rule groups within a namespace. 
		This resource is designed to handle YAML files containing multiple rule groups, 
		such as those exported from mimirtool or monitoring mixins. Each rule group 
		is managed individually via the Mimir API, but they are tracked together as 
		a single Terraform resource for easier bulk management.

inhibit_rule.description: Mutes an alert (target) matching a set of matchers when an alert (source) exists that matches another set of matchers.

name.description: Name of the alertmanager configuration. Only used for resource dependency.

org_id.description: The Organization ID. If not set, the Org ID defined in the provider block will be used.

route.description: The root node of the routing tree.

templates.description: A list of template names to use.

templates_files.description: A map of key values string, where the key is the template name and the value the content of the template.

time_interval.description: A list of time intervals for muting/activating routes.

org_id.description: The Organization ID. If not set, the Org ID defined in the provider block will be used.

stats.description: Stats list, does not account for replication factor

user.description: Query specific user stats, if not specified, all users are returned
